contentrichtext.text: [[File:William Wedgwood Benn cropped.jpg|thumb|150px|right|William Wedgwood Benn, 1st Viscount Stansgate]] [[File:Tony Benn2.jpg|thumb|150px|right|Anthony Wedgwood Benn, 2nd Viscount Stansgate, aka the politician Tony Benn, MP]] '''Viscount Stansgate''', of Stansgate in the County of Essex, is a currently disclaimed title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1942 for the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] politician and former [[Secretary of State for India]] and [[Secretary of State for Air]], [[William Wedgwood Benn, 1st Viscount Stansgate|William Wedgwood Benn]]. He was the second son of [[Sir John Benn, 1st Baronet|Sir John Benn, 1st Baronet, of The Old Knoll]]. Lord Stansgate's eldest son and heir apparent, the Hon. Michael Benn, was killed in the [[Second World War]], and he was consequently succeeded by his younger son, the second Viscount, better known as the [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] politician [[Tony Benn]]. He disclaimed the peerage in 1963 on the day the [[Peerage Act 1963]] passed into law and made it possible for him to do so. On Tony Benn's death the title will be passed on to the next in line, his elder son Stephen Benn. Both Tony Benn and his sons are in [[Remainder (law)|remainder]] to the [[Benn baronets|Benn Baronetcy of The Old Knoll]], which if it becomes [[vested interest|vested]] on that cadet branch of the family, would, as with its present holder, entitle its most senior male to the use of the formal style "Sir". ==Viscounts Stansgate (1942)== *[[William Wedgwood Benn, 1st Viscount Stansgate]] (1877–1960) **Hon. Michael Julius Wedgwood Benn (1921–1944) *[[Tony Benn|Anthony Neil Wedgwood Benn, 2nd Viscount Stansgate]] (b. 1925) (disclaimed 1963) The [[heir apparent]] is Tony Benn's son, the Hon.
